events.event_description: Fast Altamira LNG project completed one of its two Floating LNG production units (FLNG1) with a capacity of 0.2 Bcf/d, and shipped its first LNG cargo.
events.citation: The FLNG1 unit started production this summer, and the first LNG cargo from this facility was shipped in August 2024.

events.event_description: Cedar LNG project made final investment decision for a floating LNG project with 0.4 Bcf/d capacity.
events.citation: Cedar LNG—a FLNG project with capacity to liquefy up to 0.4 Bcf/d—made a final investment decision in June 2024 and expects to start LNG exports in 2028.

events.event_description: Plaquemines LNG and Corpus Christi LNG Stage III expected to begin production and ship first LNG cargoes.
events.citation: Developers expect to produce the first LNG from Plaquemines LNG and Corpus Christi LNG Stage III and ship first cargoes from these projects by the end of 2024.

events.event_description: LNG Canada plans to start LNG exports from Train 1 with 1.8 Bcf/d export capacity.
events.citation: Developers of LNG Canada (1.8 Bcf/d export capacity) plan to start LNG exports from Train 1 in the summer 2025.

events.event_description: Canada Energy Regulator authorizes four new LNG export projects including LNG Canada expansion, with combined capacity of 4.1 Bcf/d.
events.citation: In addition, the Canada Energy Regulator (CER) has authorized four LNG export projects, including an expansion of LNG Canada, with a combined proposed LNG export capacity of 4.1 Bcf/d.
